# Create seo-friendly favicon and metadata (2025-10-09 11:23Z)

_**User (2025-10-08 04:41Z)**_

Favicon → The tiny icon or logo you see on the browser tab.
Page title → The text that appears beside it (and also shows up in search results).
Metadata → The behind-the-scenes info about the web page (like title, description, author, etc.) that helps browsers and search engines understand the page.

So in short: make them for this project, clean and sick and sleek and seo friendly. also the fav icon can be the boxed ai part of the logo.. keep the description simple and seo friendly and makes it rank

+ import { MetadataRoute } from 'next'

+ export default function sitemap(): MetadataRoute.Sitemap {
+   const baseUrl = 'https://recruitai.app'
+   
+   return [

+       url: baseUrl,

+       changeFrequency: 'daily',

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>**Implementing git commands**

I need to commit and push my changes. The instructions suggest minimal verbosity but also require status updates and to-do lists. For simple tasks, I might skip to-dos, but I want to include a brief status update before making tool calls. 

Alright, I need to add `.next` files to `.gitignore` to avoid committing build artifacts. It’s safer to commit only specific paths, so I'll use `git add` for the created or modified files while ignoring `.next`. I'll run specific commands to check the current branch and remotes next.
**Attempting push**

I want to achieve a successful push, so I should go ahead and attempt the push now. If it fails, I'll need to request the remote URL. That’s an important step to ensure I have the correct destination for my commits. 

Let’s run the necessary commands to see if the push goes through. I'll keep my fingers crossed for a smooth process and be ready to handle anything that might come up!</details></think>
